decks.notes: This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on deploying efficient creatures and disrupting opponents with cards like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. The deck also utilizes cards like Anointed Peacekeeper and Skyclave Apparition to control the board and maintain pressure. With a mix of ramp from Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, as well as card advantage from Collected Company, this deck aims to establish a fast and aggressive board presence while disrupting opponents' game plans. The deck's mana base is optimized with dual lands like Razorverge Thicket and Temple Garden to ensure consistency in casting its spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field in combination with cards like Hidden Strings, Artist's Talent, and Pore Over the Pages to generate a large amount of mana and draw through the deck quickly. By assembling the right pieces, the player can chain together spells and dig deep into their library to find combo pieces and win conditions. The deck also includes interaction and protection with cards like Lightning Strike and Lier, Disciple of the Drowned to stay ahead of the opponent while setting up their combo.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and drawing cards to maintain card advantage. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion adds an additional element of control and synergy with the deck. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils to provide additional card advantage and utility. Overall, this deck aims to control the board and outvalue opponents through efficient interaction and card advantage.

This deck focuses on casting cheap spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability and bring it back from the graveyard. It includes card draw and cantrips to dig through the deck quickly and find the necessary spells to bring back the Phoenix. The deck also includes some disruption in the form of counterspells and removal to control the board while maintaining pressure with the Phoenix. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy centered around recurring the Arclight Phoenix.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on utilizing evasion, disruption, and aggressive creatures to control the board and pressure the opponent. It combines efficient removal, hand disruption, and evasive threats like Faerie Miscreant and Spyglass Siren to disrupt the opponent's game plan and deal damage quickly. The deck also includes Kaito, Bane of Nightmares as a powerful finisher and Moon-Circuit Hacker for additional card advantage. By maintaining a balance between aggression and disruption, this deck aims to outpace the opponent and secure a victory.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressively disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Archfiend of the Dross. The deck also utilizes powerful lands like Mutavault and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth to maximize its aggressiveness and consistency. Additionally, cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber provide additional value and versatility to keep the pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to swiftly close out games by overwhelming the opponent with a combination of disruption and efficient threats.
